title: Behavior not completely documented for torch.nn.Fold()
body_html:
📚 Documentation

The documentation says:
This operation combines these local blocks into the large output tensor

I believe it could be clearer, especially when the local blocks overlap in the large output tensor. In that case the local blocks will be summed, this would be nice to mention this explicitly.

I was looking for exactly that behavior and could not guess it from the doc, instead I had to come across this explanation: #7519
body_text:
📚 Documentation
The documentation says:
This operation combines these local blocks into the large output tensor
I believe it could be clearer, especially when the local blocks overlap in the large output tensor. In that case the local blocks will be summed, this would be nice to mention this explicitly.
I was looking for exactly that behavior and could not guess it from the doc, instead I had to come across this explanation: #7519
body:
## 📚 Documentation
The documentation says:
_This operation combines these local blocks into the large output tensor_ 

I believe it could be clearer, especially when the local blocks overlap in the large output tensor. In that case **the local blocks will be summed**, this would be nice to mention this **explicitly**.

I was looking for exactly that behavior and could not guess it from the doc, instead I had to come across this explanation: https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/issues/7519

<!-- A clear and concise description of what content in https://pytorch.org/docs is an issue. If this has to do with the general https://pytorch.org website, please file an issue at https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch.github.io/issues/new/choose instead. If this has to do with https://pytorch.org/tutorials, please file an issue at https://github.com/pytorch/tutorials/issues/new -->
